1.verse: Purpose of Proverbs - The proverbs of Solomon, King David’s son, from Israel:

2.verse: Their purpose is to teach wisdom and discipline, to help one understand wise sayings.

3.verse: They provide insightful instruction, which is righteous, just, and full of integrity.

4.verse: They make the naive mature, the young knowledgeable and discreet.

5.verse: The wise hear them and grow in wisdom; those with understanding gain guidance.

6.verse: They help one understand proverbs and difficult sayings, the words of the wise, and their puzzles.

7.verse: Wisdom begins with the fear of the LORD, but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

8.verse: Avoid evil associations - Listen, my son, to your father’s instruction; don’t neglect your mother’s teaching;

9.verse: for they are a graceful wreath on your head, and beads for your neck.

10.verse: My son, don’t let sinners entice you. Don’t go

11.verse: when they say: “Come with us. Let’s set up a deadly ambush. Let’s secretly wait for the innocent just for fun.

12.verse: Let’s swallow up the living like the grave— whole, like those who go down into the pit.

13.verse: We’ll find all sorts of precious wealth; we’ll fill our houses with plunder.

14.verse: Throw in your lot with us; we’ll share our money.”

15.verse: My son, don’t go on the path with them; keep your feet from their way,

16.verse: because their feet run to evil; they hurry to spill blood.

17.verse: It’s useless to cast a net in the sight of a bird.

18.verse: But these sinners set up a deadly ambush; they lie in wait for their own lives.

19.verse: These are the ways of all who seek unjust gain; it costs them their lives.

20.verse: Listen to “Woman Wisdom” - Wisdom shouts in the street; in the public square she raises her voice.

21.verse: Above the noisy crowd, she calls out. At the entrances of the city gates, she has her say:

22.verse: “How long will you clueless people love your naïveté, mockers hold their mocking dear, and fools hate knowledge?

23.verse: You should respond when I correct you. Look, I’ll pour out my spirit on you. I’ll reveal my words to you.

24.verse: I invited you, but you rejected me; I stretched out my hand to you, but you paid no attention.

25.verse: You ignored all my advice, and you didn’t want me to correct you.

26.verse: So I’ll laugh at your disaster; I’ll make fun of you when dread comes over you,

27.verse: when terror hits you like a hurricane, and your disaster comes in like a tornado, when distress and oppression overcome you.

28.verse: Then they will call me, but I won’t answer; they will seek me, but won’t find me

29.verse: because they hated knowledge and didn’t choose the fear of the LORD.

30.verse: They didn’t want my advice; they rejected all my corrections.

31.verse: They will eat from the fruit of their way, and they’ll be full of their own schemes.

32.verse: The immature will die because they turn away; smugness will destroy fools.

33.verse: Those who obey me will dwell securely, untroubled by the dread of harm.”

1.verse: Benefits of wisdom - My son, accept my words and store up my commands.

2.verse: Turn your ear toward wisdom, and stretch your mind toward understanding.

3.verse: Call out for insight, and cry aloud for understanding.

4.verse: Seek it like silver; search for it like hidden treasure.

5.verse: Then you will understand the fear of the LORD, and discover the knowledge of God.

6.verse: The LORD gives wisdom; from his mouth come knowledge and understanding.

7.verse: He reserves ability for those with integrity. He is a shield for those who live a blameless life.

8.verse: He protects the paths of justice and guards the way of those who are loyal to him.

9.verse: Then you will understand righteousness and justice, as well as integrity, every good course.

10.verse: Wisdom will enter your mind, and knowledge will fill you with delight.

11.verse: Discretion will guard you; understanding will protect you.

12.verse: Wisdom will rescue you from the evil path, from people who twist their words.

13.verse: They forsake the way of integrity and go on obscure paths.

14.verse: They enjoy doing evil, rejoicing in their twisted evil.

15.verse: Their paths are confused; they get lost on their way.

16.verse: Wisdom will rescue you from the mysterious woman, from the foreign woman with her slick words.

17.verse: She leaves behind the partner of her youth; she even forgets her covenant with God.

18.verse: Her house sinks down to death, and her paths go down to the shadowy dead.

19.verse: All those who go to her will never return; they will never again reach the ways of the living.

20.verse: So you should stay on the path of good people, guarding the road of the righteous.

21.verse: Those who have integrity will dwell in the land; the innocent will remain in it.

22.verse: But the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the treacherous will be ripped up.

1.verse: Trust in the LORD - My son, don’t forget my instruction. Let your heart guard my commands,

2.verse: because they will help you live a long time and provide you with well-being.

3.verse: Don’t let loyalty and faithfulness leave you. Bind them on your neck; write them on the tablet of your heart.

4.verse: Then you will find favor and approval in the eyes of God and humanity.

5.verse: Trust in the LORD with all your heart; don’t rely on your own intelligence.

6.verse: Know him in all your paths, and he will keep your ways straight.

7.verse: Don’t consider yourself wise. Fear the LORD and turn away from evil.

8.verse: Then your body will be healthy and your bones strengthened.

9.verse: Honor the LORD with your wealth and with the first of all your crops.

10.verse: Then your barns will be filled with plenty, and your vats will burst with wine.

11.verse: Don’t reject the instruction of the LORD, my son; don’t despise his correction.

12.verse: The LORD loves those he corrects, just like a father who treats his son with favor.

13.verse: Value of wisdom - Happy are those who find wisdom and those who gain understanding.

14.verse: Her profit is better than silver, and her gain better than gold.

15.verse: Her value exceeds pearls; all you desire can’t compare with her.

16.verse: In her right hand is a long life; in her left are wealth and honor.

17.verse: Her ways are pleasant; all her paths are peaceful.

18.verse: She is a tree of life to those who embrace her; those who hold her tight are happy.

19.verse: The LORD laid the foundations of the earth with wisdom, establishing the heavens with understanding.

20.verse: With his knowledge, the watery depths burst open, and the skies drop dew.

21.verse: Integrity of wisdom - My son, don’t let them slip from your eyes; hold on to sound judgment and discretion.

22.verse: They will be life for your whole being, and an ornament for your neck.

23.verse: Then you will walk safely on your path, and your foot won’t stumble.

24.verse: If you lie down, you won’t be terrified. When you lie down, your sleep will be pleasant.

25.verse: Don’t fear sudden terror or the ruin that comes to the wicked.

26.verse: The LORD will be your confidence; he will guard your feet from being snared.

27.verse: Don’t withhold good from someone who deserves it, when it is in your power to do so.

28.verse: Don’t say to your neighbor, “Go and come back; I’ll give it to you tomorrow,” when you have it.

29.verse: Don’t plan to harm your neighbor who trusts and lives near you.

30.verse: Don’t accuse anyone without reason, when they haven’t harmed you.

31.verse: Don’t envy violent people or choose any of their ways.

32.verse: Devious people are detestable to the LORD, but the virtuous are his close friends.

33.verse: The LORD’s curse is on the house of the wicked, but he blesses the home of the righteous.

34.verse: He mocks mockers, but he shows favor to the humble.

35.verse: The wise gain respect, but fools receive shame.

1.verse: Love wisdom - Hear, children, fatherly instruction; pay attention to gain understanding.

2.verse: I’ll teach you well. Don’t abandon my instruction.

3.verse: When I was a son to my father, tender and my mother’s favorite,

4.verse: he taught me and said to me: “Let your heart hold on to my words: Keep my commands and live.

5.verse: Get wisdom; get understanding. Don’t forget and don’t turn away from my words.

6.verse: Don’t abandon her, and she will guard you. Love her, and she will protect you.

7.verse: The beginning of wisdom: Get wisdom! Get understanding before anything else.

8.verse: Highly esteem her, and she will exalt you. She will honor you if you embrace her.

9.verse: She will place a graceful wreath on your head; she will give you a glorious crown.”

10.verse: Stay on the path of wisdom - Listen, my son, and take in my speech, then the years of your life will be many.

11.verse: I teach you the path of wisdom. I lead you in straight courses.

12.verse: When you walk, you won’t be hindered; when you run, you won’t stumble.

13.verse: Hold on to instruction; don’t slack off; protect it, for it is your life.

14.verse: Don’t go on the way of the wicked; don’t walk on the path of evil people.

15.verse: Avoid it! Don’t turn onto it; stay off of it and keep going!

16.verse: They don’t sleep unless they do evil; they are robbed of sleep unless they make someone stumble.

17.verse: They eat the bread of evil, and they drink the wine of violence.

18.verse: The way of the righteous is like morning light that gets brighter and brighter till it is full day.

19.verse: The path of the wicked is like deep darkness; they don’t know where they will stumble.

20.verse: Be careful about what you say - My son, pay attention to my words. Bend your ear to my speech.

21.verse: Don’t let them slip from your sight. Guard them in your mind.

22.verse: They are life to those who find them, and healing for their entire body.

23.verse: More than anything you guard, protect your mind, for life flows from it.

24.verse: Have nothing to do with a corrupt mouth; keep devious lips far from you.

25.verse: Focus your eyes straight ahead; keep your gaze on what is in front of you.

26.verse: Watch your feet on the way, and all your paths will be secure.

27.verse: Don’t deviate a bit to the right or the left; turn your feet away from evil.

1.verse: Avoid the mysterious woman - My son, pay attention to my wisdom. Bend your ear to what I know,

2.verse: so you might remain discreet, and your lips might guard knowledge.

3.verse: The lips of a mysterious woman drip honey, and her tongue is smoother than oil,

4.verse: but in the end she is bitter as gall, sharp as a double-edged sword.

5.verse: Her feet go down to death; her steps lead to the grave.

6.verse: She doesn’t stay on the way of life. Her paths wander, but she doesn’t know it.

7.verse: Now sons, listen to me, and don’t deviate from the words of my mouth.

8.verse: Stay on a path that is far from her; don’t approach the entrance to her house.

9.verse: Otherwise, you will give your strength to others, your years to a cruel person.

10.verse: Otherwise, strangers will sap your strength, and your hard work will end up in a foreigner’s house.

11.verse: You will groan at the end when your body and flesh are exhausted,

12.verse: and you say, “How I hated instruction! How my heart despised correction!

13.verse: I didn’t listen to the voice of my instructor. I didn’t obey my teacher.

14.verse: I’m on the brink of utter ruin in the assembled community.”

15.verse: Drink water from your own cistern, gushing water from your own well.

16.verse: Should your fountains flood outside, streams of water in the public squares?

17.verse: They are yours alone, not for you as well as strangers.

18.verse: May your spring be blessed. Rejoice in the wife of your youth.

19.verse: She is a lovely deer, a graceful doe. Let her breasts intoxicate you all the time; always be drunk on her love.

20.verse: Why, my son, should you lose your senses with a mysterious woman and embrace the breasts of a foreign female?

21.verse: The LORD’s eyes watch over every person’s path, observing all their ways.

22.verse: The wicked will be caught by their own evil acts, grabbed by the ropes of their own sin.

23.verse: Those without instruction will die, misled by their own stupidity.

1.verse: Wise advice - My son, if you guarantee a loan for your neighbor or shake hands in agreement with a stranger,

2.verse: you will be trapped by your words; you will be caught by your words.

3.verse: Do this, my son, to get out of it, for you have come under the control of your neighbor. So go, humble yourself, and pester your neighbor.

4.verse: Don’t give sleep to your eyes or slumber to your eyelids.

5.verse: Get yourself free like a gazelle from a hunter, like a bird from the hand of a fowler.

6.verse: Go to the ant, you lazy person; observe its ways and grow wise.

7.verse: The ant has no commander, officer, or ruler.

8.verse: Even so, it gets its food in summer; gathers its provisions at harvest.

9.verse: How long, lazy person, will you lie down? When will you rise from your sleep?

10.verse: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the arms to lie down—

11.verse: and poverty will come on you like a prowler, destitution like a warrior.

12.verse: Worthless people and guilty people go around with crooked talk.

13.verse: They wink their eyes, gesture with their feet, and point with their fingers.

14.verse: Their hearts are corrupt and determined to do evil; they create controversies all the time.

15.verse: Therefore, sudden disaster will come upon them; they will be quickly broken beyond healing.

16.verse: There are six things that the LORD hates, seven things detestable to him:

17.verse: snobbish eyes, a lying tongue, hands that spill innocent blood,

18.verse: a heart set on wicked plans, feet that run quickly to evil,

19.verse: a false witness who breathes lies, and one who causes conflicts among relatives.

20.verse: Danger of adultery - My son, keep your father’s command; don’t abandon your mother’s instruction.

21.verse: Bind them on your heart for all time; fasten them around your neck.

22.verse: When you walk around, they will lead you; when you lie down, they will protect you; when you awake, they will occupy your attention.

23.verse: The commandment is a lamp and instruction a light; corrective teaching is the path of life.

24.verse: They guard you from the evil woman, from the flattering tongue of the foreign woman.

25.verse: Don’t desire her beauty in secret; don’t let her take you in with her eyelashes,

26.verse: for a prostitute costs a loaf of bread, but a married woman hunts for a man’s very life.

27.verse: Can a man scoop fire into his lap and his clothes not get burned?

28.verse: If a man walks on hot coals, don’t his feet get burned?

29.verse: So is the man who approaches his neighbor’s wife; anyone who touches her will be punished.

30.verse: People don’t despise a thief if he steals to fill his starving stomach.

31.verse: But if he is caught, he must pay sevenfold; he must give all the riches of his house.

32.verse: He who commits adultery is senseless. Doing so, he destroys himself.

33.verse: He is wounded and disgraced. His shame will never be wiped away.

34.verse: Jealousy makes a man rage; he’ll show no mercy on his day of revenge.

35.verse: He won’t accept compensation; he’ll refuse even a large bribe.

1.verse: Avoid loose women - My son, keep my words; store up my commands within you.

2.verse: Keep my commands and live, and my instruction like the pupil of your eye.

3.verse: Bind them on your fingers; write them on the tablet of your heart.

4.verse: Say to wisdom, “You are my sister”; call understanding “friend,”

5.verse: so she might guard you against the mysterious woman, from the foreign woman who flatters you.

6.verse: When from the window of my house, from behind the screen, I gazed down,

7.verse: I looked among the naive young men and noticed among the youth, one who had no sense.

8.verse: He was crossing the street at her corner and walked down the path to her house

9.verse: in the early evening, at the onset of night and darkness.

10.verse: All of a sudden a woman approaches him, dressed like a prostitute and with a cunning mind.

11.verse: She is noisy and defiant; her feet don’t stay long in her own house.

12.verse: She has one foot in the street, one foot in the public square. She lies in wait at every corner.

13.verse: She grabs him and kisses him. Her face is brazen as she speaks to him:

14.verse: “I’ve made a sacrifice of well-being; today I fulfilled my solemn promises.

15.verse: So I’ve come out to meet you, seeking you, and I have found you.

16.verse: I’ve spread my bed with luxurious covers, with colored linens from Egypt.

17.verse: I’ve sprinkled my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.verse: Come, let’s drink deep of love until morning; let’s savor our lovemaking.

19.verse: For my husband isn’t home; he’s gone far away.

20.verse: He took a pouch of money with him; he won’t come home till full moon.”

21.verse: She seduces him with all her talk. She entices him with her flattery.

22.verse: He goes headlong after her, like an ox to the slaughter, like a deer leaping into a trap,

23.verse: until an arrow pierces his liver, like a bird hurrying to the snare, not aware that it will cost him his life.

24.verse: Now children, listen to me, and pay attention to my speech.

25.verse: Don’t turn your heart to her ways; don’t wander down her paths.

26.verse: She has caused many corpses to fall; she has killed many people.

27.verse: Her house is a path to the grave, going down to the chambers of death.

1.verse: Wisdom’s autobiography - Doesn’t Wisdom cry out and Understanding shout?

2.verse: Atop the heights along the path, at the crossroads she takes her stand.

3.verse: By the gate before the city, at the entrances she shouts:

4.verse: I cry out to you, people; my voice goes out to all of humanity.

5.verse: Understand skill, you who are naive. Take this to heart, you fools.

6.verse: Listen, for I speak things that are correct; from my lips comes what is right.

7.verse: My mouth utters the truth; my lips despise wickedness.

8.verse: All the words of my mouth are righteous; nothing in them is twisted or crooked.

9.verse: All of them are straightforward to those who understand, and upright for the knowledgeable.

10.verse: Take my instruction rather than silver, knowledge rather than choice gold.

11.verse: Wisdom is better than pearls; nothing is more delightful than she.

12.verse: I, Wisdom, dwell with prudence; I have found knowledge and discretion.

13.verse: To fear the LORD is to hate evil. I hate pride and arrogance, the path of evil and corrupt speech.

14.verse: I have advice and ability, as well as understanding and strength.

15.verse: By me kings rule, and princes issue righteous decrees.

16.verse: By me rulers govern, and officials judge righteously.

17.verse: I love those who love me; those who seek me will find me.

18.verse: Riches and honor are with me, as well as enduring wealth and righteousness.

19.verse: My fruit is better than gold, even fine gold; my crops are better than choice silver.

20.verse: I walk on the way of righteousness, on the paths of justice,

21.verse: to provide for those who love me and to fill up their treasuries.

22.verse: The LORD created me at the beginning of his way, before his deeds long in the past.

23.verse: I was formed in ancient times, at the beginning, before the earth was.

24.verse: When there were no watery depths, I was brought forth, when there were no springs flowing with water.

25.verse: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills, I was brought forth;

26.verse: before God made the earth and the fields or the first of the dry land.

27.verse: I was there when he established the heavens, when he marked out the horizon on the deep sea,

28.verse: when he thickened the clouds above, when he secured the fountains of the deep,

29.verse: when he set a limit for the sea, so the water couldn’t go beyond his command, when he marked out the earth’s foundations.

30.verse: I was beside him as a master of crafts. I was having fun, smiling before him all the time,

31.verse: frolicking with his inhabited earth and delighting in the human race.

32.verse: Now children, listen to me: Happy are those who keep to my ways!

33.verse: Listen to instruction, and be wise; don’t avoid it.

34.verse: Happy are those who listen to me, watching daily at my doors, waiting at my doorposts.

35.verse: Those who find me find life; they gain favor from the LORD.

36.verse: Those who offend me injure themselves; all those who hate me love death.

1.verse: “Woman Wisdom’s” invitation - Wisdom built her house; she has carved out her seven pillars.

2.verse: She slaughtered her animals, mixed her wine, and set her table.

3.verse: She sends out her female servants; she issues an invitation from the top of the city heights:

4.verse: “Whoever is naive turn aside here,” she says to those who lack sense.

5.verse: “Come, eat my food, and drink the wine I have mixed.

6.verse: Abandon your simplistic ways and live; walk in the way of understanding.”

7.verse: Wise advice - Whoever instructs the cynic gets insulted; whoever corrects the wicked gets hurt.

8.verse: Don’t correct the impudent, or they will hate you; correct the wise, and they will love you.

9.verse: Teach the wise, and they will become wiser; inform the righteous, and their learning will increase.

10.verse: The beginning of wisdom is the fear of the LORD; the knowledge of the holy one is understanding.

11.verse: Through me your days will be many; years will be added to your life.

12.verse: If you are wise, it is to your benefit; if you are cynical, you will bear it all alone.

13.verse: “Woman Folly’s” invitation - Woman Folly is noisy; she’s stupid and doesn’t even know it.

14.verse: She sits at the doorway of her house, on a seat at the city heights.

15.verse: She invites those who pass by on the path, those going straight on their way.

16.verse: “Whoever is naive, come in here,” she says to those who lack sense.

17.verse: “Stolen water is sweet; food eaten in secret is pleasant.”

18.verse: But they don’t know that the dead are there; her guests are in the depths of the grave.

1.verse: Proverbs of Solomon - The proverbs of Solomon: A wise child makes a father glad, but a foolish child brings sorrow to his mother.

2.verse: The treasure of the wicked won’t profit them, but righteousness rescues people from death.

3.verse: The LORD doesn’t let the righteous starve, but he rejects the desires of the wicked.

4.verse: Laziness brings poverty; hard work makes one rich.

5.verse: A wise son harvests in the summer; a disgraceful son sleeps right through the harvest.

6.verse: Blessings cover the head of the righteous, but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.

7.verse: The memory of the righteous is a blessing, but the name of the wicked rots.

8.verse: The skilled mind accepts commands, but a foolish talker is ruined.

9.verse: Those who walk in innocence walk with confidence, but those on crooked paths will be found out.

10.verse: Those who wink an eye bring trouble; those who speak foolishly are ruined.

11.verse: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.

12.verse: Hate stirs up conflict, but love covers all offenses.

13.verse: Wisdom is found on the lips of those who have understanding, but there is a rod for the back of those with no sense.

14.verse: The wise store up knowledge, but the mouth of a fool brings on ruin.

15.verse: The riches of the wealthy are their strong city; the ruin of the poor is their poverty.

16.verse: The wages of the righteous lead to life; the earnings of the wicked lead to sin.

17.verse: Those who heed instruction are on the way to life, but those who ignore correction lose their way.

18.verse: Lying lips conceal hate, and those who spread slander are fools.

19.verse: With lots of words comes wrongdoing, but the wise restrain their lips.

20.verse: The tongue of the righteous is choice silver, but the heart of the wicked lacks value.

21.verse: The lips of the righteous nourish many people, but fools who lack sense will die.

22.verse: The LORD’s blessing makes a person rich, and no trouble is added to it.

23.verse: Fools enjoy vile deeds, but those with understanding take pleasure in wisdom.

24.verse: What the wicked dread will come on them, but what the righteous desire will be given to them.

25.verse: After a whirlwind passes by, the wicked are no more, but the righteous stand firm forever.

26.verse: Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so are lazy people to those who authorize them.

27.verse: The fear of the LORD increases one’s life, but the years of the wicked will be cut short.

28.verse: The expectations of the righteous result in joy, but the hopes of the wicked will perish.

29.verse: The path of the LORD is a refuge for the innocent and ruin for those who do evil.

30.verse: The righteous will never be shaken, but the wicked won’t dwell in the land.

31.verse: The mouth of the righteous flows with wisdom, but the twisted tongue will be cut off.

32.verse: The lips of the wise know what is acceptable, but the mouth of the wicked knows only what is perverse.

1.verse: The LORD detests dishonest scales, but delights in an accurate weight.

2.verse: When pride comes, so does shame, but wisdom brings humility.

3.verse: Integrity guides the virtuous, but dishonesty ruins the treacherous.

4.verse: Riches don’t help in the day of wrath, but righteousness rescues from death.

5.verse: The righteousness of the innocent makes their path straight, but the wicked fall in their wickedness.

6.verse: Those who do right are saved by their righteousness, but the untrustworthy are caught by their own desires.

7.verse: When the wicked die, their hope perishes. Yes, any hope based on money perishes.

8.verse: The righteous are saved from distress, and the wicked take their place.

9.verse: The godless destroy their neighbors by their words, but the righteous are saved by their knowledge.

10.verse: When the righteous succeed, a city rejoices; when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.

11.verse: A city is honored by the blessing of the virtuous; it is destroyed by the words of the wicked.

12.verse: Whoever despises their neighbor lacks sense; a sensible person keeps quiet.

13.verse: A slanderer walks around revealing secrets, but a trustworthy person keeps a confidence.

14.verse: Without guidance, a people will fall, but there is victory with many counselors.

15.verse: Guaranteeing the debt of a stranger brings big trouble, but the one who refuses to shake hands will be secure.

16.verse: A gracious woman gains honor; violent men gain only wealth.

17.verse: Kind persons benefit themselves, but cruel people harm themselves.

18.verse: The wicked earn false wages, but those who sow righteousness receive a true reward.

19.verse: The righteous are headed toward life, but those who pursue evil, toward death.

20.verse: The LORD detests a crooked heart, but he favors those whose path is innocent.

21.verse: The evil person will surely not go unpunished, but the children of the righteous will escape.

22.verse: Like a gold ring in a pig’s nose is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.

23.verse: The desires of the righteous end up well, but the expectations of the wicked bring wrath.

24.verse: Those who give generously receive more, but those who are stingy with what is appropriate will grow needy.

25.verse: Generous persons will prosper; those who refresh others will themselves be refreshed.

26.verse: People curse those who hoard grain, but they bless those who sell it.

27.verse: Those who look for good find favor, but those who seek evil—it will come to them.

28.verse: Those who trust in their wealth will wither, but the righteous will thrive like leafy trees.

29.verse: Those who trouble their family will inherit the wind. The fool will be servant to the wise.

30.verse: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and the wise gather lives.

31.verse: If the righteous receive their due on earth, how much more the wicked and sinners?

1.verse: Those who love discipline love knowledge, and those who hate correction are stupid.

2.verse: The LORD favors good people, but he condemns schemers.

3.verse: No one is established by wicked acts, but the roots of the righteous can’t be disturbed.

4.verse: A strong woman is a crown to her husband, but a disgraceful woman is like rot in his bones.

5.verse: The plans of the righteous are just, but the guidance of the wicked is deceptive.

6.verse: The words of the wicked are a deathtrap, but the speech of those who do right rescues them.

7.verse: The wicked are destroyed and are no more, but the family of the righteous will endure.

8.verse: A person is praised for his insight, but a warped mind leads to contempt.

9.verse: Better to be held in low regard and have a servant than to be conceited and lack food.

10.verse: The righteous care about their livestock’s needs, but even the compassion of the wicked is cruel.

11.verse: Those who work their land will have plenty to eat, but those who engage in empty pursuits have no sense.

12.verse: Desiring evil is a trap for the wicked, but the root of the righteous endures.

13.verse: The wicked are trapped by the transgressions of their lips, but the righteous escape from distress.

14.verse: From the fruit of their speech, people are well satisfied; their work results in reward.

15.verse: Fools see their own way as right, but the wise listen to advice.

16.verse: Fools reveal their anger right away, but the shrewd hide their contempt.

17.verse: Those who state the truth speak justly, but a false witness deceives.

18.verse: Some chatter on like a stabbing sword, but a wise tongue heals.

19.verse: Truthful lips endure forever, but a lying tongue lasts only for a moment.

20.verse: Deceit is in the heart of those who plan evil, but there is joy for those who advise peace.

21.verse: No harm happens to the righteous, but the wicked receive their fill of trouble.

22.verse: The LORD detests false lips; he favors those who do what is true.

23.verse: The shrewd conceal their knowledge, but the heart of fools proclaims their stupidity.

24.verse: A hard worker is in charge, while a lazy one will be sentenced to hard labor.

25.verse: Anxiety leads to depression, but a good word encourages.

26.verse: The righteous offer guidance to their neighbors, but the path of the wicked makes them wander.

27.verse: The lazy don’t roast their prey, but hard workers receive precious riches.

28.verse: The way of the righteous leads to life, but the detestable path leads to death.

1.verse: A wise son listens to the discipline of his father, but a mocker doesn’t listen to correction.

2.verse: People eat well from the fruit of their words, but the treacherous have an appetite only for violence.

3.verse: People who watch their mouths guard their lives, but those who open their lips are ruined.

4.verse: The lazy have strong desires but receive nothing; the appetite of the diligent is satisfied.

5.verse: The righteous hate false words, but the wicked create disgust and scorn.

6.verse: Righteousness guards the innocent on the path, but wickedness misleads sinners.

7.verse: Some pretend to be rich but have nothing, while others pretend to be poor, but have great riches.

8.verse: Wealth can ransom a person’s life, but the poor don’t even receive threats.

9.verse: The light of the righteous rejoices, but the lamp of the wicked goes out.

10.verse: The empty-headed cause conflict out of pride; those who take advice are wise.

11.verse: Riches gotten quickly will dwindle, but those who acquire them gradually become wealthy.

12.verse: Hope delayed makes the heart sick; longing fulfilled is a tree of life.

13.verse: Trouble will come on those who despise a word, but those who respect the commandment will be rewarded.

14.verse: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life, turning a person away from deathtraps.

15.verse: Good insight brings favor, but the way of the faithless is their ruin.

16.verse: The prudent all act intelligently, but fools display their stupidity.

17.verse: Wicked messengers fall into trouble, but a reliable one brings healing.

18.verse: Poverty and shame come to those who don’t care about instruction; honor belongs to those who heed correction.

19.verse: A desire fulfilled is pleasant, but fools find deviating from evil disgusting.

20.verse: Walk with wise people and become wise; befriend fools and get in trouble.

21.verse: Trouble pursues sinners, but good things reward the righteous.

22.verse: Good people leave their grandchildren an inheritance, but the wealth of sinners is stored up for the righteous.

23.verse: A poor person’s land might produce much food, but it is unjustly swept away.

24.verse: Those who withhold the rod hate their children, but the one who loves them applies discipline.

25.verse: The righteous eat their fill, but the wicked have empty stomachs.

1.verse: A wise woman builds her house, while a foolish woman tears hers down with her own hands.

2.verse: Those who walk with integrity fear the LORD, but those who take a crooked path despise him.

3.verse: Pride sprouts in the mouth of a fool, but the lips of the wise protect them.

4.verse: When there are no oxen, the stall is clean, but when there is a strong bull, there is abundant produce.

5.verse: A truthful witness doesn’t lie, but a false witness spews lies.

6.verse: A mocker searches for wisdom and gets none, but knowledge comes quickly to the intelligent.

7.verse: Stay away from fools, for you won’t learn wise speech there.

8.verse: By their wisdom the prudent understand their way, but the stupidity of fools deceives them.

9.verse: Fools mock a compensation offering, but favor is with those who do right.

10.verse: The heart knows its own distress; another person can’t share its joy.

11.verse: The house of the wicked is destroyed, but the tent flourishes for those who do right.

12.verse: There is a path that may seem straight to someone, but in the end it is a path to death.

13.verse: The heart feels pain even in laughter, and in the end, joy turns to sorrow.

14.verse: Rebellious hearts receive satisfaction from their ways; the good receive the due reward for their deeds.

15.verse: The naive believe anything, but the prudent give thought to their steps.

16.verse: The wise are careful and avoid evil, but fools become excited and overconfident.

17.verse: Short-tempered people make stupid mistakes, and schemers are hated.

18.verse: Stupidity is the lot of the naive, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

19.verse: Evil people will bow down before the good; wicked people are at the gates of the righteous.

20.verse: Even their neighbors hate the poor, but many love the wealthy.

21.verse: Those who despise their neighbors are sinners, but happy are those who are kind to the needy.

22.verse: Don’t those who plan evil go astray? Those who plan good receive loyalty and faithfulness.

23.verse: There is profit in hard work, but mere talk leads to poverty.

24.verse: Wealth is the crown of the wise, and the folly of fools is folly.

25.verse: A truthful witness saves lives, but a deceiver proclaims lies.

26.verse: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence and refuge for one’s children.

27.verse: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, turning people away from deathtraps.

28.verse: A king’s glory is a large population, but a dwindling people is a ruler’s ruin.

29.verse: Patience leads to abundant understanding, but impatience leads to stupid mistakes.

30.verse: A peaceful mind gives life to the body, but jealousy rots the bones.

31.verse: Those who exploit the powerless anger their maker, while those who are kind to the poor honor God.

32.verse: The wicked are thrown down by their own evil, but the righteous find refuge even in death.

33.verse: Wisdom resides in an understanding heart, but it’s not known in fools.

34.verse: Righteousness dignifies a nation, but sin disgraces a people.

35.verse: The king favors an insightful servant, but is furious at a shameful one.

1.verse: A sensitive answer turns back wrath, but an offensive word stirs up anger.

2.verse: The tongue of the wise enhances knowledge, but the mouth of a fool gushes with stupidity.

3.verse: The LORD’s eyes are everywhere, keeping watch on evil and good people.

4.verse: Wholesome speech is a tree of life, but dishonest talk breaks the spirit.

5.verse: A fool doesn’t like a father’s instruction, but those who heed correction are mature.

6.verse: Great treasure is in the house of the righteous, but the gain of the wicked brings trouble.

7.verse: The lips of the wise spread knowledge, but the hearts of fools have none.

8.verse: The LORD detests the sacrifices of the wicked, but favors the prayers of those who do right.

9.verse: The LORD detests the path of the wicked, but loves those who pursue righteousness.

10.verse: Discipline is severe for those who abandon the way; those who hate correction will die.

11.verse: The grave and the underworld lie open before the LORD; how much more the hearts of human beings!

12.verse: Mockers don’t like those who correct them. They won’t go to the wise.

13.verse: A joyful heart brightens one’s face, but a troubled heart breaks the spirit.

14.verse: An understanding heart seeks knowledge; but fools feed on folly.

15.verse: All the days of the needy are hard, but a happy heart has a continual feast.

16.verse: Better a little with fear of the LORD than a great treasure with turmoil.

17.verse: Better a meal of greens with love than a plump calf with hate.

18.verse: Hotheads stir up conflict, but patient people calm down strife.

19.verse: The path of the lazy is like a hedge of thorns, but the way of those who do right is a clear road.

20.verse: A wise child brings joy to a father, but fools despise their mothers.

21.verse: Folly is joy to those who lack sense, but those with understanding walk straight ahead.

22.verse: Plans fail with no counsel, but with many counselors they succeed.

23.verse: To give an appropriate answer is a joy; how good is a word at the right time!

24.verse: For those with insight, life is an upward path, avoiding the grave below.

25.verse: The LORD snatches away the arrogant one’s house, but he preserves the widow’s boundaries.

26.verse: The LORD detests evil plans, but gracious words are pure.

27.verse: Those who acquire things unjustly gain trouble for their house, but those who hate bribes will live.

28.verse: The righteous heart reflects before answering, but the wicked mouth blurts out evil.

29.verse: The LORD is far from the wicked, but he listens to the prayers of the righteous.

30.verse: Bright eyes give joy to the heart; good news strengthens the bones.

31.verse: The ear that listens to life-giving correction dwells among the wise.

32.verse: Those who refuse discipline despise themselves, but those who listen to correction gain understanding.

33.verse: The fear of the LORD is wise instruction, and humility comes before respect.

1.verse: To people belong the plans of the heart, but the answer of the tongue comes from the LORD.

2.verse: All the ways of people are pure in their eyes, but the LORD tests the motives.

3.verse: Commit your work to the LORD, and your plans will succeed.

4.verse: The LORD made everything for a purpose, even the wicked for an evil day.

5.verse: The LORD detests all who are arrogant; they surely won’t go unpunished.

6.verse: Love and faithfulness reconcile guilt; the fear of the LORD turns away evil.

7.verse: When people draw favor from the LORD, even their enemies are at peace with them.

8.verse: Better a little with righteousness than great profits without justice.

9.verse: People plan their path, but the LORD secures their steps.

10.verse: A king’s speech is like an oracle; in a judgment, one can’t go against his words.

11.verse: Honest balances and scales are the LORD’s; all the weights in the bag are his doing.

12.verse: Kings detest wicked deeds, for their thrones are founded on righteousness.

13.verse: Kings favor those with righteous lips; they love words of integrity.

14.verse: The king’s anger is a messenger of death; the wise will calm him.

15.verse: There’s life in the light of the king’s face. His favor is like a cloud that brings spring rain.

16.verse: Acquiring wisdom is much better than gold, and acquiring understanding is better than silver.

17.verse: The road of those who do right turns away from evil; those who protect their path guard their lives.

18.verse: Pride comes before disaster, and arrogance before a fall.

19.verse: Better to be humble with the needy than to divide plunder with the proud.

20.verse: Those with insight find prosperity; those who trust the LORD are blessed.

21.verse: The skilled mind is called discerning, and pleasant speech enhances teaching.

22.verse: One who has insight is a fountain of life, but the instruction of the foolish is folly.

23.verse: The mind of the wise makes their speech insightful and enhances the teaching of their lips.

24.verse: Pleasant words are flowing honey, sweet to the taste and healing to the bones.

25.verse: There is a path that may seem straight to someone, but in the end it is the path of death.

26.verse: The appetite of workers labors for them, for their hunger presses them on.

27.verse: Worthless people dig up trouble; their lips are like a scorching fire.

28.verse: Destructive people produce conflict; gossips alienate close friends.

29.verse: Violent people entice their neighbors and walk them down a path that isn’t good.

30.verse: Those who wink their eye plot destruction; those who purse their lips plan evil.

31.verse: Gray hair is a crown of glory; it is found on the path of righteousness.

32.verse: Better to be patient than a warrior, and better to have self-control than to capture a city.

33.verse: The dice are cast into the lap; all decisions are from the LORD.

1.verse: Better a dry crust with quiet than a house full of feasting with quarrels.

2.verse: An insightful servant rules over a disgraceful son and will divide an inheritance with the brothers.

3.verse: A crucible is for silver and a furnace for gold, but the LORD tests the heart.

4.verse: An evildoer pays attention to guilty lips; a liar listens to a destructive tongue.

5.verse: Those who mock the poor insult their maker; those who rejoice in disaster won’t go unpunished.

6.verse: Grandchildren are the crown of the elderly, and the glory of children is their parents.

7.verse: Too much talking isn’t right for a fool; even less so false speech for an honorable person.

8.verse: A bribe seems magical in the eyes of those who give it, granting success to all who use it.

9.verse: One who seeks love conceals an offense, but one who repeats it divides friends.

10.verse: A rebuke goes deeper to an understanding person than a hundred lashes to a fool.

11.verse: Evil people seek only rebellion; a cruel messenger will be sent against them.

12.verse: Safer to meet a bear robbed of her cubs than fools in their folly.

13.verse: Evil will never depart from the house of those who return evil for good.

14.verse: The start of a quarrel is like letting out water, so drop the dispute before it breaks out.

15.verse: Judging the righteous wicked and the wicked righteous— the LORD detests both of these.

16.verse: Why should a fool have money to pay for wisdom? He has no mind.

17.verse: Friends love all the time, and kinsfolk are born for times of trouble.

18.verse: One with no sense shakes hands on a deal, securing a loan for a friend.

19.verse: Those who love an offense love a quarrel; those who build a high doorway invite a collapse.

20.verse: Those with crooked hearts won’t prosper, and those with twisted tongues will fall into trouble.

21.verse: Having a fool for a son brings grief; there’s no joy for a scoundrel’s father.

22.verse: A joyful heart helps healing, but a broken spirit dries up the bones.

23.verse: The wicked take secret bribes to twist the way of justice.

24.verse: Wisdom is right in front of those with understanding, but the eyes of fools are off to the edges of the earth.

25.verse: A foolish son is irritating to his father and bitter to her who gave birth to him.

26.verse: It isn’t good to punish the righteous, to strike the honorable for their integrity.

27.verse: Wise are those who restrain their talking; people with understanding are coolheaded.

28.verse: Fools who keep quiet are deemed wise; those who shut their lips are smart.

1.verse: Unfriendly people look out for themselves; they bicker with sensible people.

2.verse: Fools find no pleasure in understanding, but only in expressing their opinion.

3.verse: When the wicked arrive, so does contempt; with shame comes insult.

4.verse: The words of a person’s mouth are deep waters, a bubbling stream, a fountain of wisdom.

5.verse: Favoring the wicked isn’t good; it denies justice to the righteous.

6.verse: The lips of fools make accusations; their mouths elicit beatings.

7.verse: The mouth of fools is their ruin; their lips are a trap for their lives.

8.verse: The words of gossips are like choice snacks; they go down to the inmost parts.

9.verse: Those who are lazy in their work are brothers to thugs.

10.verse: The LORD’s name is a strong tower; the righteous run to it and find refuge.

11.verse: The riches of the wealthy are a strong city and like a high wall in their imagination.

12.verse: Pride comes before a disaster, but humility comes before respect.

13.verse: Those who answer before they listen are foolish and disgraceful.

14.verse: The human spirit sustains a sick person, but who can bear a broken spirit?

15.verse: An understanding mind gains knowledge; the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.

16.verse: A gift opens the way for access to important people.

17.verse: The first person to testify seems innocent, until the other comes and cross-examines him.

18.verse: The dice settle conflicts and keep strong opponents apart.

19.verse: An offended ally is more formidable than a city; such quarreling is like the bars of a castle.

20.verse: The stomach is satisfied by the fruit of the mouth; one’s lips can earn a satisfying income.

21.verse: Death and life are in the power of the tongue; those who love it will eat its fruit.

22.verse: He who finds a wife finds what is good, gaining favor from the LORD.

23.verse: The poor plead for help, but the wealthy answer harshly.

24.verse: There are persons for companionship, but then there are friends who are more loyal than family.

1.verse: Better to be poor and walk in innocence than to have dishonest lips and be a fool.

2.verse: Ignorant desire isn’t good; rushing feet make mistakes.

3.verse: People’s own folly corrupts their way, but their hearts rage against the LORD.

4.verse: Riches increase one’s friends, but the poor lose their friends.

5.verse: A false witness won’t go unpunished, and a liar won’t escape.

6.verse: Many seek favor from rulers; everyone befriends a gift giver.

7.verse: All the relatives of the poor hate them; even more, their friends stay far from them. When they pursue them with words, they aren’t there.

8.verse: Those who acquire good sense love themselves; those who keep understanding find success.

9.verse: False witnesses won’t go unpunished, and liars will perish.

10.verse: Luxury isn’t fitting for a fool; even less so for a servant to rule over princes.

11.verse: Insightful people restrain their anger; their glory is to ignore an offense.

12.verse: A raging king roars like a lion; his favor is like the dew on the grass.

13.verse: A foolish son is a disaster to his father; a contentious wife is like constant dripping.

14.verse: House and riches are an inheritance from one’s ancestors, but an insightful wife is from the LORD.

15.verse: Laziness brings on deep sleep; a slacker goes hungry.

16.verse: Those who keep the commandment preserve their lives; those who disregard their ways will die.

17.verse: Those who are gracious to the poor lend to the LORD, and the Lord will fully repay them.

18.verse: Discipline your children while there is hope, but don’t plan to kill them.

19.verse: Angry people must pay the penalty; if you rescue them, then you will have to do it again.

20.verse: Listen to advice and accept instruction, so you might grow wise in the future.

21.verse: Many plans are in a person’s mind, but the LORD’s purpose will succeed.

22.verse: People long for trustworthiness; it is better to be poor than a liar.

23.verse: The fear of the LORD leads to life; then one rests content, untouched by harm.

24.verse: Lazy people bury their hand in the bowl; they won’t even put it to their mouth.

25.verse: Strike someone who scoffs, and a naive person will become clever; correct someone with understanding, and they will gain knowledge.

26.verse: Those who assault their father and drive out their mother are disgraceful children, worthy of reproach.

27.verse: If, my child, you stop listening to discipline, you will wander away from words of knowledge.

28.verse: A worthless witness mocks justice; the wicked mouth gulps down trouble.

29.verse: Punishments were made for mockers, and blows for the backs of fools.

1.verse: Wine is a mocker; beer a carouser. Those it leads astray won’t become wise.

2.verse: A king is as terrifying as a lion’s growl. Those who anger him may lose their life.

3.verse: It is honorable to back off from a fight, but fools jump right in.

4.verse: The lazy don’t plow during winter; at harvest they look but find nothing.

5.verse: Advice comes from the deep waters of the heart; those with understanding can draw it out.

6.verse: Many people will say that they are loyal, but who can find a reliable person?

7.verse: The righteous live with integrity; happy are their children who come after them.

8.verse: A king who sits on his judgment throne sifts out all evil with his eyes.

9.verse: Who can say, “I’m innocent to the core; I’m cleansed from my sin”?

10.verse: False weights and measures— the LORD detests them both.

11.verse: Even young people are known by their actions, whether their conduct is pure and upright.

12.verse: Ears to hear and eyes to see— the LORD made them both.

13.verse: Don’t love sleep or you will be poor; stay alert and you will have plenty to eat.

14.verse: The buyer says, “Bad, bad,” but then goes away and brags.

15.verse: Much gold and many pearls exist, but wise speech is the most precious jewel.

16.verse: Take the garment of the person who secures a loan for a stranger; take his pledge for a foreigner.

17.verse: Stolen bread is sweet, but afterward the mouth is full of gravel.

18.verse: Plans are firmed up by advice; wage wars with good guidance.

19.verse: Gossips reveal secrets; don’t associate with those who talk too much.

20.verse: Those who curse their father or mother— their lamp will be snuffed out when it becomes dark.

21.verse: Inheritance gained quickly at first won’t bless later on.

22.verse: Don’t say, “I’ll repay the evildoer!” Wait for the LORD, and he will save you.

23.verse: The LORD detests false weights; deceptive scales aren’t right.

24.verse: A person’s steps are from the LORD; how then can people understand their path?

25.verse: It is a snare to say rashly, “It is holy,” and only reflect after making the promise.

26.verse: A wise king sifts out the wicked, and runs them over with a wheel.

27.verse: The breath of a person is the lamp of the LORD, searching all the inmost parts.

28.verse: Kindness and faithfulness protect the king; he supports his throne by kindness.

29.verse: Strength is the glory of young men; gray hair is the splendor of old age.

30.verse: Blows and bruises remove evil; beatings cleanse the inner parts.

1.verse: The king’s heart is like channels of water in the hand of the LORD; he directs it wherever he wants.

2.verse: Everyone’s path is straight in their own eyes, but the LORD weighs the heart.

3.verse: Acting with righteousness and justice is more valued by the LORD than sacrifice.

4.verse: Prideful eyes, an arrogant heart, and the lamp of the wicked are all sinful.

5.verse: The plans of the diligent end up in profit, but those who hurry end up with loss.

6.verse: Those who gain treasure with lies are like a drifting fog, leading to death.

7.verse: The violence of the wicked will sweep them away, for they refuse to act with justice.

8.verse: The ways of some people are twisted and strange, but the behavior of those who do right is pure.

9.verse: Better to live on the edge of a roof than with a contentious woman in a large house.

10.verse: Wicked people desire evil; their neighbors receive no mercy from them.

11.verse: When a mocker is punished, the naive person gains wisdom; when insight comes to the wise, knowledge increases.

12.verse: The righteous one observes the house of the wicked, turning the wicked toward trouble.

13.verse: Those who close their ears to the cries of the poor will themselves call out but receive no answer.

14.verse: A secret gift calms anger, and a hidden bribe removes furious wrath.

15.verse: Acting justly is a joy to the righteous, but dreaded by those who do evil.

16.verse: People who wander from the path of insight will rest in the company of the dead.

17.verse: Those who love pleasure end up poor; lovers of wine and oil won’t get rich.

18.verse: The wicked are a ransom for the righteous; the treacherous will be punished in the place of the virtuous.

19.verse: Better to live in a wilderness than in a house with a contentious and angry woman.

20.verse: Precious treasure and oil stay in the home of the wise, but fools swallow them up.

21.verse: Those who pursue righteousness and kindness will find life, righteousness, and honor.

22.verse: A wise person fought a city of warriors and brought down the stronghold in which they felt safe.

23.verse: Those who guard their mouths and their tongues guard themselves from trouble.

24.verse: Incredibly proud—mockers are their name! Their conduct involves excessive pride.

25.verse: The desires of the lazy will kill them, because their hands refuse to do anything.

26.verse: The lazy desire things constantly, but the righteous give without holding back.

27.verse: The LORD detests the sacrifices of the wicked, especially when brought with devious motives.

28.verse: A lying witness will perish, but one who listens will testify successfully.

29.verse: The wicked person appears brash, but the virtuous think about the path ahead.

30.verse: No wisdom, understanding, or advice can stand up against the LORD.

31.verse: A horse is made ready for the day of battle, but victory belongs to the LORD.

1.verse: A good reputation is better than much wealth; high esteem is better than silver and gold.

2.verse: The rich and the poor have this in common: the LORD made them both.

3.verse: Prudent people see trouble and hide, while the simpleminded go right to it and get punished.

4.verse: The reward of humility and the fear of the LORD is wealth, honor, and life.

5.verse: Thorns and nets are in the path of the crooked; those who guard their lives keep their distance.

6.verse: Train children in the way they should go; when they grow old, they won’t depart from it.

7.verse: The wealthy rule over the poor; a borrower is a slave to a lender.

8.verse: Those who sow injustice will harvest evil; the rod of their fury will come to an end.

9.verse: Happy are generous people, because they give some of their food to the poor.

10.verse: Remove the mocker and conflict disappears; judgment and shame also stop.

11.verse: Those who love a pure heart— their speech is gracious, and the king is their friend.

12.verse: The LORD’s eyes protect knowledge, but he frustrates the words of the treacherous.

13.verse: A lazy person says, “There’s a lion in the street! I’ll be killed in the town square!”

14.verse: The mouth of a mysterious woman is a deep pit; those under the LORD’s wrath will fall in it.

15.verse: Folly is bound up in a child’s heart; the rod of discipline removes it.

16.verse: Oppressing the poor to get rich and giving to the wealthy lead only to poverty.

17.verse: Thirty sayings of the wise - Turn your ear and hear the words of the wise; focus your mind on my knowledge.

18.verse: It will be pleasant if you keep the words in you, if you have them ready on your lips.

19.verse: So that your trust will be in the LORD, I’m teaching you today—yes, you.

20.verse: Haven’t I written for you thirty sayings full of advice and knowledge?

21.verse: Their purpose is to teach you true, reliable words, so you can report back reliably to those who sent you.

22.verse: Don’t steal from the poor, because they are poor. Don’t oppress the needy in the gate.

23.verse: The LORD will take up their case and press the life out of those who oppress them.

24.verse: Don’t befriend people controlled by anger; don’t associate with hot-tempered people;

25.verse: otherwise, you will learn their ways and become trapped.

26.verse: Don’t shake hands to guarantee a loan.

27.verse: If you can’t repay, why should they be able to take your bed from you?

28.verse: Don’t remove an ancient boundary marker that your ancestors established.

29.verse: Do you see people who work skillfully? They will work for kings but not work for lowly people.

1.verse: When you sit down to dine with a ruler, carefully consider what is in front of you.

2.verse: Place a knife at your throat to control your appetite.

3.verse: Don’t long for the ruler’s delicacies; the food misleads.

4.verse: Don’t wear yourself out trying to get rich; be smart enough to stop.

5.verse: When your eyes fly to wealth it is gone; it grows wings like an eagle and flies heavenward.

6.verse: Don’t eat food with stingy people; don’t long for their delicacies,

7.verse: because they are like a hair in the throat. They say to you, “Eat and drink!” but they don’t mean it.

8.verse: You will eat scraps and vomit them out. You will waste your pleasant words.

9.verse: Don’t speak in the ears of fools, for they will scorn your insightful words.

10.verse: Don’t remove an ancient boundary marker; don’t invade the fields of orphans,

11.verse: for their redeemer is strong. He will bring charges against you.

12.verse: Bring your mind to instruction, your ear to knowledgeable sayings.

13.verse: Don’t withhold instruction from children; if you strike them with a rod, they won’t die.

14.verse: Strike them with a rod, and you will save their lives from the grave.

15.verse: My child, if your heart is wise, then my heart too will be happy.

16.verse: My inner being will rejoice when your lips speak with integrity.

17.verse: Don’t let your heart envy sinners, but fear the LORD constantly;

18.verse: then you will have a future, and your hope won’t be cut off.

19.verse: Listen, my child, and be wise! Keep your mind straight on the path.

20.verse: Don’t hang out with those who get drunk on wine or those who eat too much meat,

21.verse: because drunks and gluttons will be impoverished; their stupor will clothe them in rags.

22.verse: Listen to your father, who gave you life; don’t despise your elderly mother.

23.verse: Buy truth and don’t sell it; buy wisdom, instruction, and understanding.

24.verse: The father of the righteous will be very happy; the one who gives life to the wise will rejoice.

25.verse: Your father and your mother will rejoice; she who gave you birth will be happy.

26.verse: My child, give your mind to me and let your eyes keep to my path.

27.verse: A prostitute is a deep pit, and a foreign woman is a narrow well.

28.verse: Indeed, she ambushes like a robber and increases the number of the faithless.

29.verse: Who is suffering? Who is uneasy? Who has arguments? Who has complaints? Who has unnecessary wounds? Who has glazed eyes?—

30.verse: those who linger over wine; those who go looking for mixed wine.

31.verse: Don’t look at wine when it is red, when it sparkles in the cup, going down smoothly.

32.verse: In the end, it bites like a snake and poisons like a viper.

33.verse: Your eyes will see strange things, and your heart will speak distorted words.

34.verse: You will be like one who lies down while out on the sea or one who lies on top of a mast.

35.verse: “Though hit, I feel no pain; though beaten up, I don’t know anything about it. When I wake up, I’ll look for wine again!”

1.verse: Don’t envy evil people, and don’t long to be with them.

2.verse: Their hearts are focused on violence, and their lips speak of trouble.

3.verse: By wisdom a house is built; by understanding it is established.

4.verse: By knowledge rooms are filled with all precious and pleasant wealth.

5.verse: A wise person is mightier than a strong one; a knowledgeable person than a powerful one.

6.verse: You should make war with guidance; victory comes with many counselors.

7.verse: Wisdom is beyond foolish people. They don’t open their mouths in the gate.

8.verse: Those who plot evil will be called master schemers.

9.verse: The scheming of fools is sin; people detest mockers.

10.verse: If you show yourself weak on a day of distress, your strength is too small.

11.verse: Rescue those being taken off to death; and from those staggering to the slaughter, don’t hold back.

12.verse: If you say, “Look, we didn’t know about it,” the one who weighs hearts—doesn’t he understand? The one who protects your life—he knows. He makes people pay for their actions.

13.verse: My child, eat honey, for it is good. The honeycomb is sweet in your mouth.

14.verse: Know that wisdom is like that for your whole being. If you find it, there is a future. Your hope won’t be cut off.

15.verse: Wicked one, don’t wait secretly at the home of the righteous. Don’t destroy their dwelling.

16.verse: The righteous may fall seven times but still get up, but the wicked will stumble into trouble.

17.verse: When your enemies fall, don’t rejoice. When they stumble, don’t let your heart be glad,

18.verse: or the LORD will see it and be displeased, and he will turn his anger from them.

19.verse: Don’t get fighting mad at evil people; don’t be envious of the wicked.

20.verse: Indeed, there is no future for the evil; the lamp of the wicked will be put out.

21.verse: Fear the LORD, my child, as well as the king. Don’t associate with those who are rebellious.

22.verse: Disaster comes suddenly from them. Who can know the ruin that both can bring?

23.verse: More sayings of the wise - These are also the sayings of the wise: Partiality in judgment isn’t good.

24.verse: Those who say to the guilty, “You are innocent”— the people will curse them. Nations will condemn them.

25.verse: But it will go well for those who rebuke them. A rich blessing will come to them.

26.verse: Those who speak honestly are like those who kiss on the lips.

27.verse: Get your outside work done; make preparations in the field; then you can build your house.

28.verse: Don’t be a witness against your neighbor without reason; don’t deceive with your lips.

29.verse: Don’t say, “I’ll do to them what they did to me. I’ll pay them back for their actions.”

30.verse: I happened upon the field of a lazy person, by the vineyard of one with no sense.

31.verse: Thorns grew all over it; weeds covered the ground, and the stone wall was falling down.

32.verse: I observed this and took it to heart; I saw it and learned a lesson.

33.verse: “A little sleep, a little slumber, a little lying down with folded arms”—

34.verse: and poverty will come on you like a prowler, deprivation like a man with a shield.

1.verse: More proverbs of Solomon - These are also proverbs of Solomon, copied by the men of Hezekiah, king of Judah:

2.verse: It is the glory of God to hide something and the glory of kings to discover something.

3.verse: Like the high heavens and the depths of the earth, so the mind of a king is unsearchable.

4.verse: Remove the dross from the silver, and a vessel will come out for the refiner.

5.verse: Remove the wicked from the king’s presence, and his throne will be established in righteousness.

6.verse: Don’t exalt yourself in the presence of the king, or stand in the place of important people,

7.verse: because it is better that he say to you, “Come up here,” than to be demoted before a ruler. What your eyes see,

8.verse: don’t be quick to quarrel over; what will you do in the future when your neighbor shames you?

9.verse: Argue it out with your neighbor, and don’t give away someone’s secret.

10.verse: Otherwise, the one who hears it will vilify you; the slander against you will never stop.

11.verse: Words spoken at the right time are like gold apples in a silver setting.

12.verse: Wise correction to an ear that listens is like a gold earring or jewelry of fine gold.

13.verse: Like the coolness of snow on a harvest day are reliable messengers to those who send them; they restore the life of their master.

14.verse: People who brag about a gift never given are like clouds and wind that produce no rain.

15.verse: A commander can be persuaded with patience, and a tender tongue can break a bone.

16.verse: If you find honey, eat just the right amount; otherwise, you’ll get full and vomit it up.

17.verse: Don’t spend too much time in your neighbor’s house. Otherwise, they’ll get fed up with you and hate you.

18.verse: People who testify falsely against their neighbors are like a club, sword, and sharpened arrow.

19.verse: Trusting a treacherous person at a difficult time is like having a bad tooth or a wobbly foot.

20.verse: Singing a song to a troubled heart is like taking off a garment on a cold day or putting vinegar on a wound.

21.verse: If your enemies are starving, feed them some bread; if they are thirsty, give them water to drink.

22.verse: By doing this, you will heap burning coals on their heads, and the LORD will reward you.

23.verse: The north wind stirs up rain, and a person who plots quietly provokes angry faces.

24.verse: Better to live on the edge of a roof than to share a house with a contentious woman.

25.verse: Good news from a distant land is like cold water for a weary person.

26.verse: A righteous person giving in to the wicked is like a contaminated spring or a polluted fountain.

27.verse: Eating too much honey isn’t good, nor is it appropriate to seek honor.

28.verse: A person without self-control is like a breached city, one with no walls.

1.verse: Like snow in the summer or rain at harvest, so honor isn’t appropriate for a fool.

2.verse: Like a darting sparrow, like a flying swallow, so an undeserved curse never arrives.

3.verse: A whip for a horse, a bridle for a donkey, and a rod for the back of fools.

4.verse: Don’t answer fools according to their folly, or you will become like them yourself.

5.verse: Answer fools according to their folly, or they will deem themselves wise.

6.verse: Sending messages with a fool is like cutting off one’s feet or drinking down violence.

7.verse: As legs dangle from a disabled person, so does a proverb in the mouth of fools.

8.verse: Like tying a stone in a sling, so is giving respect to a fool.

9.verse: Like a thorny bush in the hand of a drunk, so is a proverb in the mouth of fools.

10.verse: Like an archer who wounds someone randomly, so is one who hires a fool or a passerby.

11.verse: Like a dog that returns to its vomit, so a fool repeats foolish mistakes.

12.verse: Do you see people who consider themselves wise? There is more hope for a fool than for them.

13.verse: A lazy person says, “There’s a lion in the path! A lion in the plazas!”

14.verse: As a door turns on its hinge, so do lazy people in their beds.

15.verse: Lazy people bury their hand into the bowl, too tired to return it to their mouth.

16.verse: Lazy people think they are wiser than seven people who answer sensibly.

17.verse: Like yanking the ears of a dog, so is one who passes by and gets involved in another person’s fight.

18.verse: Like a crazy person shooting deadly flaming arrows

19.verse: are those who deceive their neighbor and say, “Hey, I was only joking!”

20.verse: Without wood a fire goes out; without gossips, conflict calms down.

21.verse: Like adding charcoal to embers or wood to fire, quarrelsome people kindle strife.

22.verse: The words of gossips are like choice snacks; they go down to the inmost parts.

23.verse: Smooth lips and an evil heart are like silver coating on clay.

24.verse: Hateful people mislead with their lips, keeping their deception within.

25.verse: Though they speak graciously, don’t believe them, for seven horrible things are in their heart.

26.verse: They may cover their hatred with trickery, but their evil will be revealed in public.

27.verse: Those who dig a pit will fall in it; those who roll a stone will have it turn back on them.

28.verse: A lying tongue hates those it crushes; a flattering mouth causes destruction.

1.verse: Don’t brag about tomorrow, for you don’t know what a day will bring.

2.verse: Let another person praise you, and not your own mouth; a stranger, and not your own lips.

3.verse: A stone is heavy and sand weighs much, but the nuisance of fools is heavier than both.

4.verse: Wrath is cruel and anger is a flood, but who can withstand jealousy?

5.verse: A public correction is better than hidden love.

6.verse: Trustworthy are the bruises of a friend; excessive are the kisses of an enemy.

7.verse: Someone who is full refuses honey, but anything bitter tastes sweet to a hungry person.

8.verse: Like a bird wandering from its nest, so is one who wanders from home.

9.verse: Oil and incense make the heart glad, and the sweetness of friends comes from their advice.

10.verse: Don’t desert your friend or a friend of your family; don’t go to your relative’s house when disaster strikes. Better a neighbor nearby than a relative far away.

11.verse: Be wise, my child, and make my heart glad, so I can answer those who insult me.

12.verse: Prudent people see evil and hide; the simpleminded go right to it and get punished.

13.verse: Take the garment of the person who secures a loan for a stranger; take his pledge for a foreigner.

14.verse: Greeting a neighbor with a loud voice early in the morning will be viewed as a curse.

15.verse: The constant dripping on a rainy day and a contentious woman are alike;

16.verse: anyone who can control her can control the wind or pick up oil in his hand.

17.verse: As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens a friend.

18.verse: Those who tend a fig tree will eat its fruit, and those who look after their master will be honored.

19.verse: As water reflects the face, so the heart reflects one person to another.

20.verse: The grave and the underworld are never satisfied; and people’s eyes are never satisfied.

21.verse: A crucible is for silver and a furnace for gold; so are people in the presence of someone who praises them.

22.verse: Even if you grind fools in a mortar, even grinding them along with the grain, their folly won’t be driven from them.

23.verse: Know your flock well; pay attention to your herds,

24.verse: for no treasure lasts forever, nor a crown generation after generation.

25.verse: When the grass goes away, new growth appears, and the plants of the hills are gathered,

26.verse: then the lambs will provide your clothes, and the goats will be the price of your fields.

27.verse: There will be enough goat’s milk for your food, for the food of your house, and to nourish your young women.

1.verse: The wicked run away even though no one pursues them, but the righteous are as confident as a lion.

2.verse: When a land rebels, there are many leaders; but a person with understanding brings order.

3.verse: Poor people who oppress the needy are rain that washes away food.

4.verse: Those who abandon Instruction praise the wicked, but those who follow Instruction battle them.

5.verse: Evil people don’t understand justice, but those who seek the LORD understand everything.

6.verse: Better to be poor and walk in innocence than to be on crooked paths and wealthy.

7.verse: Intelligent children follow Instruction, but those who befriend gluttons shame their parents.

8.verse: Those who become rich through high interest rates gather money for those who are generous to the poor.

9.verse: Those who turn their ears from hearing Instruction— even their prayers will be detested.

10.verse: Whoever misleads those who do right onto an evil path will fall into their own pit, but the blameless will inherit good things.

11.verse: Rich people think they are wise, but an insightful poor person sees through them.

12.verse: When the righteous rejoice, there is great respect, but people hide when the wicked prosper.

13.verse: Those who hide their sins won’t succeed, but those who confess and give them up will receive mercy.

14.verse: Happy are those who are continually fearful, but those whose hearts are hard fall into trouble.

15.verse: A wicked ruler over the poor is like a growling lion or a prowling bear.

16.verse: A prince without understanding is a cruel oppressor, but one who hates unjust gain will live long.

17.verse: If someone feels guilty about murder, don’t hold them back from fleeing to the pit.

18.verse: Those who walk in innocence will be saved, but those who go on twisted paths will fall into the grave.

19.verse: Those who work the land will have plenty to eat, but those with worthless pursuits will have plenty of poverty.

20.verse: Reliable people will have abundant blessings, but those with get-rich-quick schemes won’t go unpunished.

21.verse: Those who show favoritism aren’t good; people do wrong for a crust of bread.

22.verse: The stingy try to get rich fast, unaware that loss will come to them.

23.verse: Those who correct someone will, in the end, find more favor than those with flattering tongues.

24.verse: Those who steal from their father and mother, and say, “It’s not a crime,” are friends of vandals.

25.verse: Greedy people stir up conflict, but those who trust the LORD become prosperous.

26.verse: Those who trust in their own reasoning are fools, but those who walk in wisdom will be kept safe.

27.verse: Those who give to the poor will lack nothing, but those who turn a blind eye will be greatly cursed.

28.verse: When the wicked rise up, people hide, but when they are destroyed, the righteous multiply.

1.verse: One who stays stubborn after many corrections will be suddenly broken, beyond healing.

2.verse: When the righteous become numerous, the people rejoice, but when the wicked dominate, the people moan.

3.verse: A man who loves wisdom makes his father rejoice, but one who spends time with prostitutes destroys riches.

4.verse: A king gives stability to the land by justice, but one who imposes heavy taxes tears it down.

5.verse: People who flatter their friends spread out a net for their feet.

6.verse: The wicked are snared by their own sin; the righteous sing and rejoice.

7.verse: The righteous know the rights of the poor, but the wicked don’t understand.

8.verse: Mockers set a city on fire, but the wise turn back anger.

9.verse: When the wise make a legal charge against the foolish, the fools shout, they laugh—there is no calm.

10.verse: Murderous people hate the innocent, and they seek the lives of the virtuous.

11.verse: Fools show all their anger, but the wise hold it back.

12.verse: If a ruler listens to lies, those who serve him will be wicked.

13.verse: The poor and their oppressors have a common bond— the LORD gives light to the eyes of both.

14.verse: If a king judges the poor honestly, his throne will be established forever.

15.verse: The rod and correction lead to wisdom, but children out of control shame their mothers.

16.verse: When the wicked become numerous, so do crimes; the righteous will see their downfall.

17.verse: Instruct your children; they will give you peace of mind and bring delight into your life.

18.verse: When there’s no vision, the people get out of control, but whoever obeys instruction is happy.

19.verse: Servants aren’t disciplined by words; they might understand, but they don’t respond.

20.verse: Do you see people who are quick to speak? There is more hope for fools than for them.

21.verse: Pamper servants from a young age, and later on there will be trouble.

22.verse: Angry people stir up conflict; hotheads cause much offense.

23.verse: Pride lays people low, but those of humble spirit gain honor.

24.verse: Those who share plunder with thieves hate themselves; even under oath, they don’t testify.

25.verse: People are trapped by their fear of others; those who trust the LORD are secure.

26.verse: Many seek access to the ruler, but justice comes from the LORD.

27.verse: The unjust person is disgusting to the righteous; the straight path is disgusting to the wicked.

1.verse: Words of Agur - The words of Agur, Jakeh’s son, from Massa. The man declares: I’m tired, God; I’m tired, God, and I’m exhausted.

2.verse: Actually, I’m too stupid to be human, a man without understanding.

3.verse: I haven’t learned wisdom, nor do I have knowledge of the holy one.

4.verse: Who has gone up to heaven and come down? Who has gathered the wind by the handful? Who has bound up the waters in a garment? Who has established all the ends of the earth? What is this person’s name and the name of this person’s child— if you know it?

5.verse: All God’s words are tried and true; a shield for those who take refuge in him.

6.verse: Don’t add to his words, or he will correct you and show you to be a liar.

7.verse: Two things I ask of you; don’t keep them from me before I die:

8.verse: Fraud and lies— keep far from me! Don’t give me either poverty or wealth; give me just the food I need.

9.verse: Or I’ll be full and deny you, and say, “Who is the LORD?” Or I’ll be poor and steal, and dishonor my God’s name.

10.verse: More sayings of the wise - Don’t slander a servant to his master; otherwise, the servant will curse you, and you will be guilty.

11.verse: There are those who curse their father and don’t bless their mother.

12.verse: There are those who think they are clean, but haven’t washed off their own excrement.

13.verse: There are those— how arrogant are their eyes; how their eyebrows are raised!

14.verse: There are those whose teeth are swords; their jaw is a butcher’s knife, ready to devour the needy from the earth, and the poor from humanity.

15.verse: The leech has two daughters: “Give, give!” There are three things that are never satisfied, four that never say, “Enough!”:

16.verse: the grave and a barren womb, a land never filled with water, and fire that doesn’t say, “Enough!”

17.verse: An eye that mocks a father and rejects obedience to a mother, may the ravens of the river valley peck it out, and the eagle’s young eat it.

18.verse: Three things are too wonderful for me, four that I can’t figure out:

19.verse: the way of an eagle in the sky, the way of a snake on the rock, the way of a ship out on the open sea, and the way of a man with a young woman.

20.verse: This is the way of an adulterous woman: she eats and wipes her mouth, and she says, “I’ve done nothing wrong!”

21.verse: At three things the earth trembles, at four it can’t bear up:

22.verse: at a servant when he becomes king and fools when they are full of food;

23.verse: at a detested woman when she gets married and a female servant when she replaces her mistress.

24.verse: Four things are among the smallest on earth, but they are extremely wise:

25.verse: Ants as creatures aren’t strong, but they store away their food in the summer.

26.verse: Badgers as creatures aren’t powerful, but they make their homes in the rocks.

27.verse: Locusts don’t have a king, but they march together in ranks.

28.verse: You can catch lizards in your hand, but they are in kings’ palaces.

29.verse: There are three things that are excellent in their stride, four that are excellent as they walk:

30.verse: a lion, a warrior among beasts, which doesn’t back down at anything;

31.verse: the strut of a rooster or a male goat; and a king with his army.

32.verse: If you’ve been foolish and arrogant, if you’ve been scheming, put your hand to your mouth,

33.verse: because churning milk makes curds, squeezing the nose brings blood, and stirring up anger produces strife.

1.verse: Words of King Lemuel - The words of King Lemuel of Massa, which his mother taught him:

2.verse: No, my son! No, son of my womb! No, son of my solemn promises!

3.verse: Don’t give your strength to women, your ways to those who wipe out kings.

4.verse: It isn’t for kings, Lemuel, it isn’t for kings to drink wine, for rulers to crave strong drink.

5.verse: Otherwise, they will drink and forget the law, and violate the rights of the needy.

6.verse: Give strong drink to those who are perishing and wine to those whose hearts are bitter.

7.verse: Let them drink and forget their poverty and no longer remember their toil.

8.verse: Speak out on behalf of the voiceless, and for the rights of all who are vulnerable.

9.verse: Speak out in order to judge with righteousness and to defend the needy and the poor.

10.verse: The competent wife - A competent wife, how does one find her? Her value is far above pearls.

11.verse: Her husband entrusts his heart to her, and with her he will have all he needs.

12.verse: She brings him good and not trouble all the days of her life.

13.verse: She seeks out wool and flax; she works joyfully with her hands.

14.verse: She is like a fleet of merchant ships, bringing food from a distance.

15.verse: She gets up while it is still night, providing food for her household, even some for her female servants.

16.verse: She surveys a field and acquires it; from her own resources, she plants a vineyard.

17.verse: She works energetically; her arms are powerful.

18.verse: She realizes that her trading is successful; she doesn’t put out her lamp at night.

19.verse: She puts her hands to the spindle; her palms grasp the whorl.

20.verse: She reaches out to the needy; she stretches out her hands to the poor.

21.verse: She doesn’t fear for her household when it snows, because they are all dressed in warm clothes.

22.verse: She makes bedspreads for herself; fine linen and purple are her clothing.

23.verse: Her husband is known in the city gates when he sits with the elders of the land.

24.verse: She makes garments and sells them; she supplies sashes to traders.

25.verse: Strength and honor are her clothing; she is confident about the future.

26.verse: Her mouth is full of wisdom; kindly teaching is on her tongue.

27.verse: She is vigilant over the activities of her household; she doesn’t eat the food of laziness.

28.verse: Her children bless her; her husband praises her:

29.verse: “Many women act competently, but you surpass them all!”

30.verse: Charm is deceptive and beauty fleeting, but a woman who fears the LORD is to be praised.

31.verse: Let her share in the results of her work; let her deeds praise her in the city gates.
